meanings.definition: A person who engages in dishonest or fraudulent behavior.
meanings.sent1: The gypsters tricked the old lady out of her savings.
meanings.sent2: Be careful of gypsters who try to scam you online.
meanings.sent3: The gypsters thought they could outsmart everyone, but they were caught red-handed.
meanings.sent4: The gypsters were like wolves in sheep's clothing, preying on unsuspecting victims.
meanings.sent5: The image of the gypsters swindling people stayed in her mind, warning her to be cautious.

meanings.sent1: He tried to gypsters his way out of paying for the damages.
meanings.sent2: She felt betrayed when she realized he had gypstered her all along.
meanings.sent3: The kids gypstered each other during the game, trying to win by any means.
meanings.sent4: His smooth talking gypstered even the most cautious of investors.
meanings.sent5: The con artist gypstering his victims was finally caught by the authorities.

meanings.sent1: The gypsters scheme was finally uncovered by the authorities.
meanings.sent2: She refused to be part of any gypsters business deals.
meanings.sent3: The gypsters behavior was so obvious, it was almost comical.
meanings.sent4: The gypsters tactics were like a dark shadow looming over the town.
meanings.sent5: The gypsters reputation for deceit spread far and wide, making people wary of any dealings with them.
